intro: Wahlenbergia minuta, commonly known as the dwarf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-20 centimeters and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in rocky or coastal areas and is known for its compact, herbaceous growth habit. Wahlenbergia minuta is a popular ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and vibrant flower color.
